pageContent: Background: Prostate cancer (PCa) is the most commonly diagnosed malignancy in men and the second leading cause of cancer death in developed countries. Despite the primary treatments, 20-30% of patients experience a recurrence. The main objective of this study was to evaluate the clinical efficacy of salvage high intensity focused ultrasound (HIF U) after radical prostatectomy in terms of biochemical free survival rate (BFSR) and PSA nadir.

metaData.source:
Maximizing outcomes in genitourinary cancers across the treatment continuum
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21382149/
